website_summaries.verdict: Nice reaching tool for those who don't need a lot of length. Provides good control.
pros: Reacher has a maximum length of 19 inches
Easier to control than longer units
Jaw can rotate 90 degrees to give the unit greater flexibility
Nice grippable materials in the reacher head
Doesn't weigh much, which is helpful for many people
cons: Only 19-inches long, so will not work adequately in every situation

customer_reviews.title: Extend Your Reach Easily
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and easy to use, we purchased this 19" grabber to reach washed clothing from a front-load washer (see photos). It is very convenient to use, simplifies unloading and spares our aging backs. Well worth the cost. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tampadoc

customer_reviews.title: I didn't want to admit I needed one of these, but I'm glad I did.
customer_reviews.text: Since I am getting older and rounder, I can not reach the places I could in my younger years. I decided it was time to bite the bullet and buy my first "old person tool". After a lot of searching locally, and a lot of online research, I selected the RMS. I must live right, because it is exactly what I needed. It fits comfortably in my hand, the length is just right, the jaws are rotatable as needed, and especially, the padded jaws allow me to pick up almost anythng! Definitely worth the money, and something everyone whose mobility is becoming limited and/or who can't reach quite as far as they used to should consider buying.
customer_reviews.author: Lonelydad

customer_reviews.title: Its sturdy and I like that it pivots
customer_reviews.text: Its sturdy and I like that it pivots. It will also fit into the kitchen drawer. These reachers have added a lot of storage space in my kitchen and the shorter ones allow for more control then a 32". I have one in every room. I keep the short ones in the kitchen where I am more likely to be using it for small but heavy objects.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea411

customer_reviews.title: Great for laundry help
customer_reviews.text: This thing is pretty solidly constructed and is the perfect length to help my little T-Rex arms get the socks out of the bottom of the washing machine. The longer ones you find most places are awkward for reaching into the washer. The only complaint I have is that the jaws don’t hold onto items as firmly as I’d like; the grabbers that have two opposing suction cups grip better, but I haven’t found one in this length. Overall very good. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: cocobuttr

customer_reviews.title: The idea behind the grabber is great, just not the cheap parts used
customer_reviews.text: The internal mechanism that moves the grabber when you pull the trigger broke within one day of light use by my 71 year old Mother in Law. The idea behind the grabber is great, just not the cheap parts used.
customer_reviews.author: no on

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy
customer_reviews.text: Good quality of the materials and the mechanism. The length of this grabber is more convenient than the longer ones. Update: Although my initial evaluation was five stars, as it turned out the grabber is very weak and things slip from it. Had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: AT

customer_reviews.title: Pick up Prongs don’t line up- can’t pick up things
customer_reviews.text: I liked that the product was lightweight and seemingly pretty sturdy unfortunately the grabber prongs don’t meet so you can’t even pick up a piece of cloth or a pair of pants that Fell on the floor and I bought it primarily to help with getting dressed so that others wouldn’t be inconvenienced. I think if the prongs on the reacher would meet together that it would be a nice product I like the length which is shorter because I find it easier to handle
customer_reviews.author: G. Pillars

customer_reviews.title: Great Grabber tool!
customer_reviews.text: great tool for picking up things you drop or get items out of the refrigerator cabinets whatever you need to pick up. this was my second one of the 19" length. and I use it all the time. my first one lasted over a year of daily use, it wore out so I ordered another one, again it worked perfectly for all my needs!? I noticed that the cable was starting to fray and would soon fail. I contacted the seller manufacturer and as soon as they had my mailing address they sent a brand new one. a great product and if anything goes wrong they correct it promptly, by sending a new replacement one. great product and company!B
customer_reviews.author: frank w

customer_reviews.title: Keep your family safe from falls
customer_reviews.text: This is a reacher I bought for my mother, I bought her two. This is a superb style of reacher that is more ideal for picking up larger or heavier items. I am a health care professional and can attest that these tools are very expensive from medical suppliers. This is an excellent price and is supported by Amazon. These tools keep you or your loved ones needing to bend over and pick things off the floor or try to struggle for things up high, these are high reasons for falls in the home. I recommend buying a bit of sticky velcro to attach to the reacher and walker (if using one) to keep this device always handy. Be safe!
customer_reviews.author: L. Short

customer_reviews.title: Received dirty used product.
customer_reviews.text: It came in good packing. But it seems that someone used it before. It seems dirty. The product works fine. Also, looking at the product quality, the price is way too much for the product.
customer_reviews.author: Nishigandha Sonavane

customer_reviews.title: pricey, but the length was right
customer_reviews.text: I use this to retrieve items my 2 year old has thrown out of my reach in the backseat of the car, so the 19" length is perfect. I feel like it's a bit pricey for what it is, though I did have to pay more for the length as the common folding 30+" models are cheaper. the tips also don't seem to line up properly when fully closed, so some items tend to slip out if I try to pinch with the tips.
customer_reviews.author: ffej101

customer_reviews.title: Short.
customer_reviews.text: Super short. You basically have to bend down anyway. Return costs are astronomical. Don’t purchase this it’s useless. Stick to a longer one but it feels cheap so maybe not this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Laura A

customer_reviews.title: First idem a piece of paper off the floor went ...
customer_reviews.text: First idem a piece of paper off the floor went to pick up the cable broke or came apart, sent it back
customer_reviews.author: Terry L Hammersley

customer_reviews.title: Very handy (no pun intended)
customer_reviews.text: The size and weight are perfect. I also have a heavy 36 inch grabber and this 19 is a delight for quick close pickups. It isn't strong enough for heavy use but overall I'm quite satisfied. The claws don't meet exactly which I find irritating but that doesn't affect the function. I'm concerned about long term durability but if it broke tomorrow I would immediately buy another. Just too many good things about it. If you need this sort of thing you'll quickly understand why I won't be without one again.
customer_reviews.author: RLC

customer_reviews.title: Great for picking up items around a chair.  Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I have purchased, and I LOVE it. I have one in my sewing area and can pick up individual thread pieces from a hardwood floor, or a single straight pin. It has two extensions on the end of the pinchers are flexible soft rubber and are great for picking up and holding on to things like a plastic bobbin. I have it hanging on a hook on the wall next to my sewing table. Got this one for use around the kitchen, I have arthritis in my hands and have trouble picking up small pills if I happen to drop them, this thing can grab and hold a tiny sliver or small pill.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah S. Koch

customer_reviews.title: Quality of Life saver!
customer_reviews.text: I went with all the positive reviews, wondering a little at the shorter shaft. It's such a wonderful product that I bought a second one. I'm recovering from major surgery, which makes having one critical in the bedroom and in the kitchen. I've picked up dropped water bottles, papers, and one tiny pill. With the pincher rotated, there has been nothing I couldn't reach and pick up. I just purchased the third one for my sister's 92 year old Father-in-Law. Btw, the shorter shaft creates a stronger control.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Wesserling

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tool for seniors or handicapped
customer_reviews.text: I have five of these distributed all over the house. Perfect for getting those wet clothes sticking to the bottom of our over-sized washer. I have one hooked to my walker and anything dropped, no matter how large or small, is easily retrieved. I sometimes find kitty hair bombs on the carpeting and this little picker upper picks them up and I don’t have to bend over to get to the clump of hair. I have been able to pick up the tiniest little things as well as larger, heavier items. Perfect tool for anyone having difficulty bending over or reaching things without getting on a stool.
customer_reviews.author: MrsGriz

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I can't reach the bottom of my new washing machine. The handle is a bit short, but it's all I need. The gripper is strong enough to hold on to wet towels and jeans long enough to get them out of the washer. It also has a tip that won't let things just slide on off of it. It's a sturdy little thing, too. You don't save money buying cheap grippers if you need a gripper that actually HELPS with 'heavy lifting'. Until I bought this one, we were breaking those cheapo ones left and right.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly K. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great for close quarters.
customer_reviews.text: I use this in the car, when I'm stuck at a light, and trying to reach something that fell onto passenger side floor. I tried the longer style but it was like trying to get in the elevator while carrying a ladder. In a word... Awkward! This little gripper is lightweight, and versatile. My only negative is the gripper fingers are a bit too slippery, but otherwise I like it alot.
customer_reviews.author: DrewLuvsKarin49

customer_reviews.title: Great little grabber
customer_reviews.text: I have a longer one, but this is the perfect size for grocery shopping from my power chair. It is short enough to fit on my lap or fit in an umbrella bag and hang from the arm rest. But it's also long enough to reach things on the top shelf as well as getting them off bottom shelves. This is the first time I've been able to complete an entire trip to the store without asking people to reach things for me. It also has a rubberized firm grip so it holds onto things well. The end rotates to both a horizontal and a vertical position making it easy to grab things from different angles.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Macon

customer_reviews.title: Broke almost instantly
customer_reviews.text: For the first few minutes, I thought this thing was amazing. The, I tried rotating the gripper part at the end and it broke so that the gripper just hung limply. Maybe I did something wrong, but there were no instructions with the damn thing. Threw it in the trash. VERY disappointed as my wife really needed this.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Binkelman

customer_reviews.title: Great for a Shorty Like Me
customer_reviews.text: Being only 5 ft. tall, I got a set of two for reaching items on top shelves. I keep the shorter one in my car for getting items off the top shelf at supermarkets. They are a great timesaver and allow me to use my top kitchen shelves which are otherwise useless without dragging a step-stool out every time I need something. I try to keep seldom-used items up high but now I can put some lighter everyday items up there too and finally make use of all the space available.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super handy shorter grabber
customer_reviews.text: This shorter grabber is incredibly handy as all of the previous reviews stated. Much, much easier than the longer grabbers. This is comfortable, very light and doesn't have that annoying joint in the center causing it to flip oversideways when retrieving an item. The end of the part that grabs can pick up incredibly annoying tiny things due to a rubber gripper that extends over the end of the mouth of the grabber. I'm getting a few more. Super cool
customer_reviews.author: Susan R

customer_reviews.title: It's not even sturdy! Good as a grabber toy for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: What was I thinking?! This is a very very short grabber, ridiculously short ! I must return it ! Doesn't reach anywhere... It's not even sturdy! Good as a grabber toy for toddlers!
customer_reviews.author: Keren

customer_reviews.title: You'll wish you'd always had one!
customer_reviews.text: Fortunately I bought this before my hip replacement surgery - afterward I discovered it was a must-have.The price is very reasonable considering the capabilities it offers. The rubber gasket in the grabber mechanism makes it easier to grasp stuff. Because I could only put a limited number of things next to my bed without over-cluttering, I had to set stuff farther away. From my bed, I used it not only for bringing things to me but also for putting things on shelves and in the trash and recycle bins I set up near my bed. I've ordered two more - one to pluck waste from my cat's litter box and an extra which I'm sure I'll find a use for.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Jo Culler

customer_reviews.title: Excellent grabber, but be aware of length
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent grabber but too short, really, for most people who are standing when they need to pick something up. For the chairbound this would be exactly right. I didn't pay attention to the size when I bought it but have kept it for the bedroom, where I sit in a chair while dressing and frequently drop things.
customer_reviews.author: BCM Texas

customer_reviews.title: Update Broke within first month of purchase
customer_reviews.text: As an 87 year old post-polio survivor I spend many hours a day in bed. This implement is very handy for reaching things on or close to my bed. I have not tried the suction aspect of the grabber, but I will. I find it a little less flexible than I had anticipated, but it will be very useful to me. Update. It broke after less than a month of minimal usage. It no longer opens or closes. You cannot attempt to remedy the issue because of its construction. Please issue a refund
customer_reviews.author: Merle F

customer_reviews.title: Love the 19" length!
customer_reviews.text: I love the Grabber Reacher! I am rather short and had a hard time reaching small items in my deep washing machine, so was looking for something that would reach to the bottom without being too long to handle. The 19" grabber works perfect. It is made well, light weight, easy to use. It easily picks up wet clothes which can be heavy. It is also easy to use to wipe the bottom of the washing machine tub when I want to clean it. It can be hung close to the washer, or propped up by the side for easy retrieval. I recommend this to anyone that has that problem! So happy with the quality and price of the Grabber!
customer_reviews.author: Retired in Texas

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: My wife recently had minor back surgery, recommended not to bend or lift for several weeks. Just try to keep this woman down: she uses this grabber to get laundry out of the dryer, to get light bowls out of the lower kitchen cabinet, picking up sticks in the yard, just about anything lightweight and down to low to bend over and pick up.
customer_reviews.author: Jim M

customer_reviews.title: Nice grabber for lighter & hard to grab items!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent shorter grabber for when you don't have to reach the floor. I've found that it is only good for light to medium weight objects so you don't want to try picking up a large canned item with it. The ends have some flexibility that makes it perfect for small hard to grab items like a bandaid or coin. I've even been able to clean up a piece of potato chip without crushing it. Nice grabber for lighter items!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Then I showed him what it was for like picking up his toys off the floor and it ...
customer_reviews.text: Not as long as I thought and barely reaches my top shelf cupboards. It is difficult to use though if you have any heavy items and have weakness, injury, or arthritis in your arm or hand. I think I might try a larger one next time. My 2 year old grandson found it and started to use it as a gun since it has that trigger look. Then I showed him what it was for like picking up his toys off the floor and it was a whole new game!!
customer_reviews.author: Colleen Lorentzen

customer_reviews.title: Best reacher/grabber made!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the RMS 19" reacher to go with the longer one I already had and loved. I'm 82 years old and only 4'10" tall and need reachers to grab things from my cabinets as well as pick up the many things I manage to drop during the day. This one easily fits on the side of my walker. I've tried different brands of grabbers before, and RMS's are worth the little extra they cost. They advertise they will pick up a dime, and they will, or the tiniest scrap of paper you can drop. Worth every cent!
customer_reviews.author: Carol C.

customer_reviews.title: Best one yet
customer_reviews.text: Worth the money. Very sturdy. The pincer end can be rotated which is a big plus. My wife has MS and has dexterity issues with her hands. The grip end is robust enough where she doesn't have issues holding on to it. I have bought cheaper ones over the years but they are usually thinner and delicate and do not last. I would recommend this product to anyone that is looking for a lasting quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Gary R

customer_reviews.title: Gap when closed
customer_reviews.text: Being disabled, "reachers" have been very beneficial for me. I saw this one which had a shorter reach than my current one and the rubber tips seemed like they would be of a great use. Wrong. When closed, there is a gap a little bigger than 1/4" that doesn't grip envelopes, mail, etc I dropped and need to see. Wish I had never purchased this one.
customer_reviews.author: Shadalee

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered my Graber Reacher prior to having my back surgery. I am so pleased that I did! While in the hospital the occupational therapy instructors came by and showed and demonstrated a cheap reaching unit (garbage). I had also looked at our local pharmacy prior to purchasing the Graber Reacher (cheaply made). Please do yourself a favor and consider purchasing this product you will not be disappointed. It is well built as well as being very nimble to pick up the smallest objects. Great Product!
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Never be without it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a surprisingly strong and I,m constantly amazed at the tiny things I can pick up with it, too. I love these things so much, I have them spread around in practically every room in the house, even in the shower. Doing laundry would be so much harder without them... I have arthritis and can't reach into the bottom of the washer without aggravating my hip. I use the grabber to reach in and pull out clothes and swing them down to the dryer. It's kind of fun. I highly recommend this grabber. It holds up well and has a thousand and one uses.
customer_reviews.author: BP G.

customer_reviews.title: Best thing since sliced bread! You need one of these.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something that would pick up things from places I could not reach and this is perfect. It’s sturdy, very comfortable to use and the shorter length is just right. It seems very well made - unlike some of the flimsy ones that you find. Maybe it’s because of the shorter length or material it’s made of. I picked up a ballpoint pen from the floor with no issue. The pinchers hold everything securely. I may have to buy at least one more of these for use upstairs.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Camille

customer_reviews.title: Good tool.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the length of the grip tool and I like that head will twist for a different grabbing direction. I can carry it on my wallet and pick items off the floor as I walk. I wish it were made of metal or a harder plastic. The string which makes the tool open and close appears very thin. I tried to pull a jar of peanut butter from a high shelf, but I just couldn't pull it down. If you just need it for small, light objects, it is a good too and lightweight to carry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT FOR ME!
customer_reviews.text: I have problems with balance and bending over to pick up something is dangerous since I cannot get back up if I fall on the floor. Thank God for my friendly firefighters! Now they won't get so many calls from me, though, because this handy little grabber does the trick and now I can even pick up pills, coins, etc while seated in my chair. I can also grab the remote for the fan off the side table and papers that slid off my stool. I debated whether I should order the short or long grabber, but the short one is perfect for me!
customer_reviews.author: Sunspot

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: This works really well for smaller objects. I picked up a piece of paper that had slid under the bed and a textile paint tube that had fallen into a hard to reach corner. It also grasps cans in my pantry. It isn't big enough to pick up a large box of microwave popcorn because it isn't wide enough. Still, it works for many of the things I had trouble reaching. I'd like to see a bigger one for larger boxes etc.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Pick up that shred of paper!!!!  Yay!
customer_reviews.text: I have a longer grabber that I use in my dryer for fishing out clothes, but I got this shorter one for picking things up off the floor when I'm in my wheelchair. This is a terrific grabber! It has a firm grip and even picks up small pieces of paper, shreds, really. It picks up heavier things too, and feels really sturdy. Finally, you can pull the head out and turn it so that the pickup angle rotates so that it is horizontal rather than vertical. Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Shayladane

customer_reviews.title: Not to happy to spend this much $ on an item to ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these at the same time, one broke on th left first use the second one is still working. Not to happy to spend this much $ on an item to have it break on the first use. Will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hand grip is awkward.
customer_reviews.text: I got this because l have arthritis in my hands. I wanted something sturdy...which it is. It is a little shorter than l had hoped. The grip with my hand is awkward...the hand grip is too big for comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth himes maslin

customer_reviews.title: I bought the short one.
customer_reviews.text: I'm five foot and a busted can of biscuits. I can get the last sock out of the washer without falling in headfirst. I even got a penny out of the bottom of the washer with it. I can reach stuff on the top shelves in my kitchen. Will grab anything. Wish it had a way to hang it in my closet. Wish I'd bought this sooner.
customer_reviews.author: JSW

customer_reviews.title: Save yourself time and injury
customer_reviews.text: I love this tool. I made a bag out of an old ripstop tote and it slides in and out easily. I take this in the car shopping. I’m an Instacart shopper 5’2” and I can’t reach any items on the top shelf or in the back of the food freezers. This has saved me time. No waiting for a clerk to help. In fact the deli clerk saw me using it and said I need one. I used it to wipe dry the top of my car I just grabbed a rag and wiped the middle of the front & back window too. I LOVE THIS! Not too long. Fits in the grocery basket on the child’s seat.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great stability
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my relative, the longer ones were too long and the 19” seemed perfect. it is the perfect length for her and the ability to change the direction of the claw is great and the stability the tool has being able to do that. I think I’d purchase for our home as well when we want one, great product!!
customer_reviews.author: SarahP.

customer_reviews.title: Great length, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad i ordered this reacher. It is very easy to use, I'm using it to help me dress after a hip replacement. I don't know how i'd do it myself without it. I like it because the grabber part is big and has a lot of (rubber)? at the end to keep things attached, without slipping off the end. It is just the perfect size for my needs. Not too long, but a perfect length for grabbing clothing items and helpful to reach and put on clothing.
customer_reviews.author: DiamondGirl

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I use this to get the laundry out of my oversize washer since I'm short. The only problem I have is when I have a heavier item. I reach in and grab it once its high enough. Otherwise, it's perfect for my use.
customer_reviews.author: Mamag241

customer_reviews.title: get that last sock out of your washer!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I am short and the new washers are DEEP. Instead of struggling to get that last sock....this works perfectly for my use! NO, I am not that old, just short......Honestly, I can pick up a dime with this or a stray thread. EVERY short or elderly person could really use this item.
customer_reviews.author: example

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! Pickup Tool
customer_reviews.text: This is now my sidekick. It will pick up the thinnest piece of paper flat on the floor. The head will rotate to give you a better line of attack. I'm trying to figure out how to attach it to my cane (yes, for real) so it is always with me since I've become a bit klutzy. I can use it while sitting down. It's seventeen inch length makes it perfect for kitchen cabinets and reaching down whether standing or seated. I do keep several longer ones around, but this model has become my favorite./
customer_reviews.author: Meticularius

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: My husband has a disability that makes reaching very difficult. He's used a grabber for years. As time goes on it's become increasingly difficult to reach items that are close. He has lamented that, "if only there were a shorter grabber". Living in a small Maine town, I turned to Amazon. My husband is thrilled with this tool. The quality is exceptional and the 19 inch length gives him some valued independence. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Maine Gal

customer_reviews.title: One of the best
customer_reviews.text: Perfect length which is hard to find. If you are picking something up with the idea of putting it in your hand one of the 36" grabbers probably won't work for you. If you want to pull up a pair pants a 36" grabber will be difficult to work with. I also use this in the shower when I drop things there. This you can get wet without shortening its life. Be advised none of these grabbers are going to allow you to pick up a very heavy weight and I have purchased a wide variety over the years.
customer_reviews.author: Juju

customer_reviews.title: This is a short length grabber, when a short tool is needed
customer_reviews.text: I own the longer version of this grabber, and its great where an extension is needed to reach items beyond normal reaching distance like high shelves, but sometimes a grabber is needed to pick up items dropped on the floor, while a person may be sitting, and that's where this shorty version comes in handy. Both the long and short versions of Grabber are excellent quality and very well made
customer_reviews.author: gejome

customer_reviews.title: Great Help When Holding Baby
customer_reviews.text: Great pincher. My wife and decided to buy one so we can grab things that fall to the floor or just out of reach while holding our new baby.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler R.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our new washing machine
customer_reviews.text: Got this to help the wife get clothes out of our new washing machine, which is very deep. This grabber is the perfect size and helps her out a lot. She used to have to fish the clothes out with a hanger (or call me to do it). This is so much easier and faster. She loves it.
customer_reviews.author: James M.

customer_reviews.title: multi RMS user
customer_reviews.text: we started with one and now own 4 of these beauties. they really help. My husband and I both have Arthritis and I just had a hip replacement. these have been a wonderful aid. The kitchen one gets used the most, lifting canned and dry goods, pot lids, little pieces of paper that drop and all kinds of miscellaneous droppings and reaching. We even pick up the dog dishes. Get one and see what we are so in love with.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Kay

customer_reviews.title: RMS Grabber
customer_reviews.text: the grabber stays balanced on my walker. It is used numerous times daily. Very useful in picking up small or large items. It fits my hand and I can squeeze trigger easily. the length is perfect! I caused to malfunction .. Ordered replacement immediately. It's become my third arm and fingers.
customer_reviews.author: L. Craig

customer_reviews.title: GREAT functionally & TOP quality!
customer_reviews.text: Ingenious! Aesthetically a knockout. Most grabber are stuck in the 19th Century. They are visual nuts and bolts and work that way. This is the 22nd Century grabber. The parts flow like one very effective unit. Some products look and function like a work of art. They wind up in the MOMO. Expect to see this beauty there. This is pone of those, "Why didn't someone think of this sooner?"
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Harper

customer_reviews.title: Perfect aid for my power chair.
customer_reviews.text: Like many who are wheelchair bound, I often need to retrieve dropped items. Compared to the longer reachers, I find that the shorter grabber and the sturdy construction provides greater maneuverability. In addition, the sure and precise grip is a revelation. I recently purchased the 19" Hand-Grip Grabber Reacher and upon inspection immediately ordered a second one to keep in the car for shopping trips . It is perfect for reaching the upper shelve and the lower shelves in the supermarket and is a perfect size for my power chair. .
customer_reviews.author: A. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Must have for anyone
customer_reviews.text: Love this little grabber. I have a bigger one that's over 20 years old and I can tell this one is better constructed. The grabber part rotates easily once I figured I needed to pull it out before turning it. I love that feature and the shorter length is easier to work with the my old one.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: this is the best size
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I got this. After hip replacement surgery I am limited in the degree I can bend my hip whether sitting or bending. And I seem to be very clumsy right now. This is excellent. It's shorter than many similar products I've seen which I think makes it easier to use. I can each up to upper shelves easily (and I'm short). It also reaches all the way to the ground where so many things are winding up.
customer_reviews.author: Archie

customer_reviews.title: RMS 19" Grabber is Good Length But Not Easy to Squeeze
customer_reviews.text: The RMS 19" Grabber requires more strength in your hand than other grabbers. I cannot squeeze the grip to easily use the grabber and must return the item. I am keeping the VIVE 32 Inch and the Pikstik Grabber. Both are easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Woman

customer_reviews.title: Hands Down - THE BEST
customer_reviews.text: Every aspect of this item, from the easy pull trigger, through the cable connection, to the tongs is [hands down] top quality and very easy to use! I keep mine handy on a Toolflex tool holder attached to my chair. I'm a real butterfingers and have a problem bending over.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy D.

customer_reviews.title: Get it, it works!
customer_reviews.text: I like this so much I kept it and use it even after I've healed from my knee replacement. I keep it on my desk. I see why they call it the "Handi Grip Grabber" It does come in so very handy! It exceeded my expectations for one very good reason, it will pick up even the tiniest things. I picked up a toothpick that feel between my desk and the wall! Now, that is something to brag about. haha :)
customer_reviews.author: M.S.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and agile grabber.
customer_reviews.text: This is actually the second one of these grabbers that I've purchased. I bought the second to have one handy in the basement. These grabbers are amazingly agile due to their pliable rubber coated tips. You can easily pick up small items like the tiny screws found throughout computers. You can even pick up coins with it. They also look and feel very well made, unlike the longer grabbers you often find in hardware and home improvement centers.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin J. Osiowy

customer_reviews.title: I would say its okay. 19" for me too short
customer_reviews.text: I think this is just an okay product. I think the aluminum one that looks more like a claw coming down the stick is better. Also, I think the 19" version is a little short. I think at least 26" is more useful.
customer_reviews.author: C. Ip

customer_reviews.title: I don't need to get on my knees to pick up something anymore.
customer_reviews.text: I got this to help me get items off the floor/ground. I'm a very stiff person, and have difficulties getting things on the ground. I can bend down most of the way, just not low enough. So I didn't want a typical grabber that is longer. This one is perfect. It's long enough that I don't need to bend down too far. Long enough it can reach everything I want. Short enough that it travels well, and will store easily.
customer_reviews.author: Joey B.

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I use it to pick up trash from all the trashy people driving along the highway. SO much easier than stooping, plus I don't have to touch any of the trash. This thing works great, will pick up anything from the tiniest sliver of plastic or styrofoam to liter soda bottles.
customer_reviews.author: Sojourner Truth

customer_reviews.title: Length
customer_reviews.text: Have used for quite a while because of the length. It is perfect because I do crafts and it is handy for its reach. I now have a second and intend to order two more to have in more rooms. I recently broke my leg have used it for everything every day. Helps dressing, especially when clothes get stuck on the Velcro on the boot. It does not help pulling the Velcro tight but has so many other uses I couldn't along without it.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy R

customer_reviews.title: Best tool
customer_reviews.text: I would be lost without this!! It's the perfect grabber! It's length is one of its best features. While the longer ones have their place, this shorter one is perfect in so many situations for me. I had back surgery and now need help reaching things on the floor that I drop. This has been my best tool. And the rubber tips make picking up something as small as an earring a breeze!!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer J. Enochs

customer_reviews.title: Handy little gadget
customer_reviews.text: This gripper is a handy little gadget. I got it to help me out after recent shoulder surgery. It has done just that. I have been able to reach items that were in awkward places or too high to reach. It even picked up a tiny pill! The 19" length is perfect for me since I'm short. It's like an extension of my arm and provides more control than a longer one. While I hate the idea of having to use a gripper, I love having this around and I'm sure I will continue to use it long after my recovery.
customer_reviews.author: phendrix

customer_reviews.title: Now I can get my laundry out of my washer!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a top loading washer that was big enough to wash my comforter, but it didn't occur to me it was too big for me to reach any part of a regular load of clothes! This little gadget solved the problem. It is strong enough to pull out the heaviest wet laundry, but also managed to retrieve a quarter on the washer floor that escaped from a pocket . Perfect for my needs and was delivered quickly.
customer_reviews.author: cinnamon girl

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful.
customer_reviews.text: I injured my back and couldn't bend over during the healing process. My occuoational therapist strongly recommended I get thus tyoe of an aid. But she cautioned against a gripper with a long handle because it increases the leverage.everage plus any weight of and item. Not good fir my back. I was thrilled ti fins this shorter option. It is well made and did the job. It cannot pick up heavy item like heavy wet sheets in my washer, but I found that I could grip a small portion of the sheet a just enough to enable me to pull it outvof the washer a little bit at a time. It felt so good to regain some life skills back.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne Ann Humphreys

customer_reviews.title: A must have grabber!
customer_reviews.text: You cant go wrong with this style of grabber. It can easily pick up anything - for me especially, that means getting glasses off shelves without having them crash and shatter on the floor. The inner side is fully rubberized, and the two pinchers allow you to pick up very small or very thin items without any damage to the item you want to pick up. Won’t be without one ever again! PERFECTLY designed for ease of use!
customer_reviews.author: Deb Lindstrom

customer_reviews.title: Easy Light Reacher
customer_reviews.text: I love this reacher . It can be turned around and angled to reach light boxes or bags. I used it to position and retrieve spices bottles and jello boxes. I used it to get light cans. It is a great light weight reacher for picking up light items. I use it for paper,cards, leaves, light twigs, paper clips, etc. This is great for any light items that are not bulky or go beyond reacher width.This is not meant for heavy items.
customer_reviews.author: Robin O.

customer_reviews.title: The perfect gripper!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 1 of these, then a second one, while I was still in rehab after back surgery. I have them in different rooms. Today I even picked apples with one. I love this product. It's made very well, picked up anything I need, from apples to tiny things off the floor. It's easy to hold and operate with my bad hand and holds onto anything. Bravo! You have a perfect gripper.
customer_reviews.author: gloria merritt

customer_reviews.title: Great until it’s not...
customer_reviews.text: This grabber is great until it unexpectedly snaps whilst lifting the paper... 5 stars until it broke on me.. 🥴
customer_reviews.author: Big Josh

customer_reviews.title: RMS 19" Grabber Is Heavy Duty And A Quality Product.
customer_reviews.text: This grabber is being used with a deep upright washing machine and is excellent. Heavy duty and quality grabber compared to other brands. Will handle heavy items and perfect for a newer deep tub washing machine. Can be used for any heavy application vs the flimsy light weight grabbers. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ponderer

customer_reviews.title: Best Grabber I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I am always on the look out for a quality grabber/reacher like this one. Even though it is shorter than most grabbers, the feel, the strength, the ease of use and the over all look are just great. In fact, I like this so much I am going to order a couple of more to have in various places around the house and carry in my vehicles. This works so well, I picked up a stamp off the floor with it. It is not bulky, easy to store and does not get in the way.
customer_reviews.author: Rick M.

customer_reviews.title: Grab one you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. The 19" length is a good size for me to reach the top shelves in my kitchen. I now can get to things on the top shelves much quicker rather than getting a set of steps. Now the top shelves can be used for everyday items instead of dead storage. If it was longer if would be harder to control when you have something heavy in the jaws. The jaws are well designed so you can grab most anything you want with it.
customer_reviews.author: St Helier Mark

customer_reviews.title: Hoping To Use This To Pull Nutgrass
customer_reviews.text: Nice little tool, perhaps a bit short. I was hoping to avoid having to bend over to pull nutgrass, the bane of my existence ... ;^). The gripper is not quite strong enough to pull out weeds like this. I have found the device useful to pick up things that I'd otherwise have to bend over for.
customer_reviews.author: ShermanBBQ

customer_reviews.title: Ok but flimsy
customer_reviews.text: OK but flimsy and poor construction. It's not likely to last long in moderate use. Good size and easy to use. I'll keep unless it fails during return period.
customer_reviews.author: DHB

customer_reviews.title: I should check out my order more closely 😊
customer_reviews.text: I guess I ordered the wrong one . as far as I can tell this has no magnetic ability and it is a lot shorter than what I thought. But it is okay for what I can use to pick up so I can use it. The construction feels good and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Lison

customer_reviews.title: Amazing grabber tool
customer_reviews.text: I had to review this because it has revolutionized by kitchen cabinets. We live in an old house with really tall upper cabinets, which is awesome, but difficult to use being only 5'2". I needed something small so I could keep it inside the cabinet (or else my daughter would walk off with it) but long enough to be able to reach spices or pantry items on the top shelves. This thing is perfect!! I couldn't be happier. Of course it works for small, light items, but I used it yesterday for a box of kosher salt! Really great grabber.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for getting clothes out of a deep washing machine
customer_reviews.text: We bought a new washing machine that has a very deep tub. A couple of the shorter people ;-) in my house can't reach all the clothes in it after the cycle stops. This works well at getting the last few socks etc. out and into the dryer.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kimbrough

customer_reviews.title: CLOSER
customer_reviews.text: AT 91, WITH MS AND A FEW OTHER THINGS, T FIND THAT IT IS TOO DIFFICULT TO MAINTAIN A FIRM GRIP UNTIL THE ITRM IIS CLOSE ENOUGH TO GRAB. IHAD ONE YEARS AGO MADE OF WOOD THAT HAD LASTED FOR ABOUT 5 YRS DESPITE BEING RUN OVER MANY TIMES BE AN ELEC WHEELCHAIR. IT WAS LT WEIGHT AND SMALL.
customer_reviews.author: Frances R Geller

customer_reviews.title: RMS GRABBER REACHERS
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a 19" and then purchased a 32" grabber. They are great! I like them because they are very well made, very sturdy. They are also very light weight and so easy to use. Other grabber I have bought from other companies tend to be very flimsy or heavy. I have problems with arm strength but these grabber are perfect to use. Thank You.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: I have a longer grabber I use, but the shorter one is useful as well and is made better with a better set of "jaws". Having an extra set around the house means I don't have to go on a hike every time I drop something. This will help a lot until and after I have my hip replaced later this year.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis D Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great Grabber!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these - one for my mom and one for me. They are wonderful! It's great that you can change the grabber part to fit your needs. Just pull and turn. So easy to use. Am quite impressed at how easily it works and the fact that the grabber part actually hangs on to what you are picking up! Would highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Janie

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: This RMS Handi Grip Reacher is excellent. It is very well-made, and its 19" length is perfect for reaching the top shelf in my kitchen cabinets. I am very glad I don't have to take out my step stool to reach "things" anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Carbine

customer_reviews.title: Handy short range gripper
customer_reviews.text: This gripper works well for grabbing things off the refridgerator shelf or the pantry at a short range. The yellow grippy part covers the innermost part of the gripper works better than other grippers who are not fully lined, especially for glass jars. If upper body strength is impaired, as mine is it can be difficult to hold the gripper closed with heavy objects, but overall a nice gripper. I am not super tall( 5'5") so I had a harder time reaching taller shelves in the pantry as this gripper is not very long and doesn't telescope. All in all its a handy short range gripper.
customer_reviews.author: Amber R. Landis

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Grip!!
customer_reviews.text: Most excellent gripping power, from very small items to larger items. I tested the grip to pick up a dime on the floor to a can of soup above the head. They passed with the highest marks! Just wish I could locate one several inches longer.
customer_reviews.author: david a yarborough

customer_reviews.title: Handy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband who is recovering from cancer and chemotherapy. He has found it very helpful in reaching for items, picking up clothes, etc. from the floor, help with putting on pants and socks. He has found it easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: pamh

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the gripper because I wanted a shorter one than my current ones. When it arrived, I was happy to see the quality of the product. When riding in the truck as a passenger, and being buckled in, there are many times that I wish to reach things without taking off my seat belt. That's why I wanted a shorter one to go with me. This works great!
customer_reviews.author: Wilma Flintstone from Bateman

customer_reviews.title: A Real Partner, in the Kitchen and Elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: This Tool is so helpful in the kitchen while I am cooking, because I cook sitting in my Hoveround wheel chair. Why I didn't think of such a tool much earlier instead of getting up and down, I'll never know. Thak You for Your kind inquiry. Respectfully, K.S.H.
customer_reviews.author: KSH

customer_reviews.title: Evens the playing field when you have short arms and drive an SUV
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use in my car because I constantly drop things or my purse falls over and the keys or cell phone fall out and I can't reach them because my arms are too short. This has turned out to be the perfect solution! It is just the right length and it doesn't take up a lot of space. So far everything I have dropped has been easily retrieved.
customer_reviews.author: Simon'sMom

customer_reviews.title: Not as expected
customer_reviews.text: I expected this to extend and reach the higher shelves that I can't reach without a step stool. This little grabber only extended my reach by 4 feet. Not even strong enough to help pull out damp clothes from the washer.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley C.

customer_reviews.title: Very good grip!
customer_reviews.text: It’s very handy. It’s like an extension of my short arms and it grips very well. I use it constantly inside my bedroom for reaching just about everything. I really like it plus it is made well and very sturdy!
customer_reviews.author: Nene

customer_reviews.title: like small athletic socks
customer_reviews.text: I just got a new Maytag Bravos XL washing machine, but it is much larger than my old machine and I had a hard time reaching down to the bottom to retrieve things. I came up with the idea of getting a grabber, and this shorter one is just the right size for reaching into the bottom and picking up even the smallest items, like small athletic socks. It's perfect!
customer_reviews.author: dempsl

customer_reviews.title: Not worth postage!
customer_reviews.text: This Grabber is not worth postage. Two days swivel portion of the Grabber snapped grabbing a regular bottle of ketchup, ONE GRABBER DOWN, KETCHUP DOWN. I miss the ketchup more
customer_reviews.author: JL Golightly

product_meta.title: RMS 19 Inch Handi Grip Reacher
feature_bullets: 19-inch version of the Hand Grip reacher family is an ideal solution for where extra long reach is not needed, helpful for individuals in wheelchair
Head rotates 90 degrees to reach from any angle
Flexible finger-like tip allows for picking up the smallest of items
Ergonomic handle provides a very comfortable grip
The shaft is made from lightweight aluminum and the internal wire is made from steel cable for durability and easy of use

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
